title: RuneFest

properties.name: description
properties.value: RuneFest is the name of the annual Jagex-run real world event for RuneScape players.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:RuneFest
"Fest" redirects here. For the wiki's in-game community event, see Wikifest.
The current RuneFest Logo.

RuneFest is the name of the annual Jagex-run real world event for RuneScape players.

Contents

  • 1 RuneFests
  • 2 In-game rewards
    • 2.1 2017 Runefest shield
    • 2.2 2014 Runefest home teleport animation
  • 3 Information from YouTube and Jagex Mod clan chats
  • 4 Trademarks
  • 5 References

RuneFests[edit | edit source]

  • RuneFest 2020 - Cancelled due to the COVID-19 pandemic
  • RuneFest 2019 - 4 October and 5 October 2019
  • RuneFest 2018 - 5 October and 6 October 2018
  • RuneFest 2017 – 23 September 2017
  • RuneFest 2016 – 17 September 2016
  • RuneFest 2015 – 3 October 2015
  • RuneFest 2014 – 11 October 2014
  • RuneFest 2013 - 2 November 2013
  • RuneFest 2012 - Originally planned to go ahead, but announced as cancelled September 2012
  • RuneFest 2011 - 29 October and 30 October 2011
  • RuneFest 2010 - 28 August 2010

In-game rewards[edit | edit source]

2017 Runefest shield[edit | edit source]

To promote the 2017 event, the Runefest shield was given to players who redeemed the code runefest17 using Diango's right-click "redeem-code" feature. The code was intended to be revealed for RuneFest attendees and those tuning in to the all-day stream on twitch.tv/runescape on 23 September 2017. However, it was obtained a day earlier than intended due to players successfully guessing the code.

2014 Runefest home teleport animation[edit | edit source]

The RuneFest 2014 Home Teleport animation.

A home teleport animation override could be unlocked by redeeming the code osrsrf2014 from Diango. The teleport features a cow, and can be toggled by right clicking the home teleport in the spellbook.

Information from YouTube and Jagex Mod clan chats[edit | edit source]

On 24 March, Mark Gerhard's second interview was released on the RuneScape YouTube channel. At two seconds into the video, the words "RuneFest 2010" were visible on a whiteboard behind Mods Paul M and Mark G.[1]

On 7 April, Mark Gerhard was asked in his Clan Chat, "Mark, can you shine a light on RuneFest for us?" to which he replied:

“ Aah RuneFest, seems our worst kept secret so far. We are planning a real world event for the players currently code named RuneFest. I can't give too much away otherwise the team will be beat me with my own shoes But I suppose I can say that I'm really excited about meeting the player(s). As are the rest of the Jagex family. Take care and hopefully see you all soon Irl. ”
 
— Mark Gerhard

On 11 April, Mark Gerhard said the follow regarding RuneFest in his Clan Chat:

“ Runescape nation was the project name for RuneFest. No RuneFest will go international afterwards, the 1st will be in England. Yeah it will go on tour :) I can't say too much about RuneFest though as the will club be [sic] to death with my own shoes if I do :) There will be official coms on RuneFest to follow shortly I'm sure ”
 
— Mark Gerhard

In response to, "Will there be a music element to RuneFest as hinted in the trademark apps?"

“ Yes Rule :) ”
 
— Mark Gerhard

Trademarks[edit | edit source]

  • On 18 March 2010, RuneFest.com was registered by Jagex[2].
  • On 29 March, 2010, trademark applications were filed for "RuneFest"[3], "Jagex Nation"[4] and "RuneScape Nation"[5]. Both RuneScapeNation.com and JagexNation.com are owned by Jagex[6][7].

The trademark classes for RuneFest, RuneScape Nation and Jagex Nation are:

“

Class 09: Audio recordings; video recordings; audio-visual recordings; pre-recorded publications; downloadable electronic publications; data-carriers for audio and visual and audio-visual recordings; CDs; DVDs.

Class 16: Printed publications; printed matter; books, leaflets, brochures; posters, postcards, stationery.

Class 25: Clothing, footwear, headgear.

Class 41: Entertainment; organising, promotion and production of entertainment and events; organising, production and presentation of shows, staged events, theatrical performances, concerts, live performationces and audience participation events; musical entertainment; live musical entertainment; production, presentation and distribution of sound and video recordings; provision of recreational facilities; arranging and conducting festivals; arranging and conducting competitions; arranging and conducting events relating to computer games and video games and Internet games; information and advisory and consultancy services relating to all of the foregoing.

”
 
— British Intellectual Property Office [3][4][5]

References[edit | edit source]

  1. ↑ Jagex. "Inside Jagex Games Studio - Mark Gerhard Interview Part 2." (00:00:02), YouTube video. 24 March 2010.
  2. ↑ Runefest.com Whois Lookup (Web). 16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC).*
  3. ↑ 3.0 3.1 Intellectual Property Office. Case details for Trade Mark 2543331 (Web). 04:33, December 26, 2012 (UTC).*
  4. ↑ 4.0 4.1 Intellectual Property Office. Case details for Trade Mark 2543329 (Web). 16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC).*
  5. ↑ 5.0 5.1 Intellectual Property Office. Case details for Trade Mark 2543330 (Web). 16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC).*
  6. ↑ Who.is. Runescapenation.com Whois Lookup (Web). 16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC).*
  7. ↑ Who.is. Jagexnation.com Whois Lookup (Web). 16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC).*

rawContent: {{External|rs}} {{redirect3|Fest|For the wiki's in-game community event, see {{RSL|Wikifest}}}} [[File:RuneFest_2017_and_Golden_Gnome_Awards_(1).png|thumb|The current RuneFest Logo.]] '''RuneFest''' is the name of the annual [[Jagex]]-run real world event for ''[[RuneScape]]'' players. ==RuneFests== * RuneFest 2020 - Cancelled due to the {{wp|COVID-19 pandemic}} * {{RSL|RuneFest 2019}} - [[4 October]] and [[5 October]] [[2019]] * {{RSL|RuneFest 2018}} - [[5 October]] and [[6 October]] [[2018]] * {{RSL|RuneFest 2017}} – [[23 September]] [[2017]] * {{RSL|RuneFest 2016}} – [[17 September]] [[2016]] * {{RSL|RuneFest 2015}} – [[3 October]] [[2015]] * {{RSL|RuneFest 2014}} – [[11 October]] [[2014]] * {{RSL|RuneFest 2013}} - [[2 November]] [[2013]] * RuneFest 2012 - Originally planned to go ahead, but announced as cancelled September [[2012]] * {{RSL|RuneFest 2011}} - [[29 October]] and [[30 October]] [[2011]] * {{RSL|RuneFest 2010}} - [[28 August]] [[2010]] ==In-game rewards== ===2017 Runefest shield=== [[File:Runefest shield detail.png|right|75px]] To promote the 2017 event, the [[Runefest shield]] was given to players who redeemed the code runefest17 using [[Diango]]'s right-click "redeem-code" feature. The code was intended to be revealed for RuneFest attendees and those tuning in to the all-day stream on [https://www.twitch.tv/runescape twitch.tv/runescape] on [[23 September]] [[2017]]. However, it was obtained a day earlier than intended due to players successfully guessing the code. ===2014 Runefest home teleport animation=== [[File:Home Teleport (RuneFest 2014).gif|200px|right|thumb|The RuneFest 2014 Home Teleport animation.]] A [[home teleport]] [[Animation overrides#Home Teleport|animation]] override could be unlocked by redeeming the code osrsrf2014 from Diango. The teleport features a cow, and can be toggled by right clicking the home teleport in the [[spellbook]]. ==Information from YouTube and Jagex Mod clan chats== On 24 March, {{RSL|Mark Gerhard}}'s second interview was released on the ''RuneScape'' YouTube channel. At two seconds into the video, the words "RuneFest 2010" were visible on a whiteboard behind Mods Paul M and Mark G.{{CiteVideo |url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3E8SGb3-PeI&t=2 |timestamp=00:00:02 |author=Jagex |title=Inside Jagex Games Studio - Mark Gerhard Interview Part 2 |date=24 March 2010 |site=}} On 7 April, Mark Gerhard was asked in his [[Clan Chat]], "Mark, can you shine a light on RuneFest for us?" to which he replied: {{cquote2|Aah RuneFest, seems our worst kept secret so far. We are planning a real world event for the players currently code named RuneFest. I can't give too much away otherwise the team will be beat me with my own shoes But I suppose I can say that I'm really excited about meeting the player(s). As are the rest of the Jagex family. Take care and hopefully see you all soon Irl.|Mark Gerhard}} On 11 April, Mark Gerhard said the follow regarding RuneFest in his Clan Chat: {{cquote2|Runescape nation was the project name for RuneFest. No RuneFest will go international afterwards, the 1st will be in England. Yeah it will go on tour :) I can't say too much about RuneFest though as the will club be [sic] to death with my own shoes if I do :) There will be official coms on RuneFest to follow shortly I'm sure|Mark Gerhard}} In response to, "Will there be a music element to RuneFest as hinted in the trademark apps?" {{cquote2|Yes Rule :)|Mark Gerhard}} ==Trademarks== * On [[18 March]] [[2010]], RuneFest.com was registered by Jagex{{CiteGeneral |url=http://www.who.is/whois/RuneFest.com |title=Runefest.com Whois Lookup |accessdate=04:33, December 26, 2012 (UTC)|format=Web |date=16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC)}}. * On 29 March, 2010, trademark applications were filed for "RuneFest"{{CiteGeneral |url=http://www.ipo.gov.uk/types/t-find-number?trademark=2543331 |title=Case details for Trade Mark 2543331 |accessdate=04:33, December 26, 2012 (UTC)|format=Web |author=Intellectual Property Office |date=04:33, December 26, 2012 (UTC)|name=runefestipo}}, "Jagex Nation"{{CiteGeneral |url=http://www.ipo.gov.uk/types/t-find-number?trademark=2543329 |title=Case details for Trade Mark 2543329 |accessdate=04:33, December 26, 2012 (UTC)|format=Web |author=Intellectual Property Office |date=16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC) |name=jagexnationipo}} and "RuneScape Nation"{{CiteGeneral |url=http://www.ipo.gov.uk/types/t-find-number?trademark=2543330 |title=Case details for Trade Mark 2543330 |accessdate=04:33, December 26, 2012 (UTC)|format=Web |author=Intellectual Property Office |date=16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC) |name=runescapenationipo}}. Both RuneScapeNation.com and JagexNation.com are owned by Jagex{{CiteGeneral |url=http://www.who.is/whois/RuneScapeNation.com |title=Runescapenation.com Whois Lookup |accessdate=04:33, December 26, 2012 (UTC)|format=Web |author=Who.is |date=16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC)}}{{CiteGeneral |url=http://www.who.is/whois/JagexNation.com |title=Jagexnation.com Whois Lookup |accessdate=04:33, December 26, 2012 (UTC)|format=Web |author=Who.is |date=16:34, February 5, 2011 (UTC)}}.
